articles.title: Young victims of California bar shooting include recent college graduate
articles.description: Details are emerging about the 12 people killed when a gunman opened fire at a California bar. One was just 18, and another recently graduated from college. "CBS Evening News" anchor Jeff Glor has more.

articles.title: Chilling video shows inside of California bar as shooter opened fire
articles.description: There is dramatic new video from the scene of a mass shooting at a California bar. The gunman, a former Marine, stormed in, deployed smoke bombs and opened fire. CBS News correspondent Carter Evans reports.

articles.title: California bar shooting: New information on gunman and weapon
articles.description: Twelve people, including a sheriff's sergeant, were killed in a mass shooting at a crowded bar in Thousand Oaks, California, Wednesday night. Jeff Pegues reports with information about the gunman and the weapon he used.

articles.title: How medical devices like pacemakers, insulin pumps can be hacked
articles.description: The U.S. government is taking a closer look at how to stop hackers from taking control of medical devices like pacemakers. Two cybersecurity researchers showed us how devices like pacemakers and insulin pumps can be hacked. Anna Werner reports.

articles.title: Will acting attorney general limit the special counsel Russia probe?
articles.description: Some Democrats call the appointment of Matthew Whitaker, the acting attorney general, a "constitutional crisis." Even some Republicans say it's imperative that Robert Mueller's special counsel investigation be allowed to continue. Paula Reid reports.

articles.author: CBS Radio News
articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 11/08
articles.description: A gunman kills 12 at a southern California bar. Jeff Sessions forced out as Attorney General. CNN's Jim Acosta barred from covering the White House. CBS News Correspondent Steve Kathan has today's World News Roundup.

articles.title: Witnesses on "utter chaos" and escape from California bar shooting
articles.description: Thirteen people, including a sheriff's sergeant and a suspected gunman, were killed in a shooting at a crowded Southern California bar Wednesday night. Cole Knapp and Matt Wennerstrom were inside the Borderline Bar & Grill when the gunfire started.

articles.title: Attorney General Jeff Sessions forced to resign
articles.description: President Trump is looking for a new attorney general after finally forcing Jeff Sessions to quit. The former Alabama senator said an emotional good bye to Justice Department staffers Wednesday night. Sessions is now one of 41 high-ranking Trump administratio…

articles.title: 11/7/18: CBSN Evening News
articles.description: Jeff Sessions out as Attorney General; Refugees make history in 2018 election

articles.title: How Jeff Sessions' resignation could affect special counsel investigation
articles.description: Jeff Sessions is the first to leave the Trump administration after the midterm elections. His exit could have profound effects on special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation. CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe reports.

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Voters reject judge who approved no jail time for man who pleaded guilty to felony assault
articles.description: Judge Michael Corey oversaw the sentencing with no jail time for Justin Schneider​, who police said offered a ride to a woman, choked her until she blacked out and masturbated on her
articles.content: ANCHORAGE, Alaska -- Alaska voters have turned out a judge who signed off on a plea deal that let a man serve only one year of home confinement for assaulting an Alaska Native woman. In September, Superior Court Judge Michael Corey oversaw the sentencing with… [+2222 chars]

articles.title: 11/7/18: Red and Blue
articles.description: Jeff Sessions out as Attorney General; Anthony Scaramucci on Session's resignation

articles.title: Congresswoman-elect Donna Shalala: Democrats should only pursue impeachment if there is "legal evidence"
articles.description: Ahead of her victory, Donna Shalala, congresswoman-elect for Florida's 27th district, spoke with CBSN political reporter Caitlin Huey-Burns before winning her election about if Democrats should pursue impeachment against President Trump.

articles.title: Why did Democrats win governorships across the midwest only to be crushed in Ohio?
articles.description: Democrats flipped gubernatorial seats in Kansas, Michigan, Illinois, and Wisconsin on Election Day, but fell far short in the state of Ohio. Larry Sabato, director of the University of Virginia Center for Politics spoke to Red and Blue to explain why.

articles.title: Congressman-elect Steve Horsford: Immigration is about keeping families together
articles.description: Ahead of his victory, Steven Horsford, congressman-elect for Nevada's 4th district, spoke with CBSN political reporter Caitlin Huey-Burns about immigration policy after President Trump send active-duty soldiers to the U.S.-Mexico border as a caravan of asylum…

articles.title: Boeing issues safety alert for 737 Max 8 jets
articles.description: Boeing and the FAA are warning airlines about sensors that might malfunction on 737 Max 8 jets, potentially causing the nose to push down during flight. It's being investigated as a possible cause in a deadly crash in Indonesia.

articles.title: Mitt Romney wins Utah Senate race
articles.description: Mitt Romney is finally heading to Washington after the former Republican presidential nominee won a seat in the Senate from Utah. He may be a rookie senator, but he has an influential voice. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford reports.

articles.title: Midterm elections result in most diverse Congress ever
articles.description: When the 116th U.S. Congress opens in January, it will be as the most diverse Congress ever. That's thanks to a number of big wins in the midterms. CBS News Washington correspondent Paula Reid reports.

articles.title: Nevada Governor-elect Steve Sisolak on gun control measures in his state
articles.description: Ahead of his victory, Nevada Governor-elect Steve Sisolak spoke with CBSN political reporter Caitlin Huey-Burns on the campaign trial in Las Vegas about his views on gun control measures in his state.

articles.title: Susie Lee says impeachment proceedings would be a "distraction"
articles.description: Ahead of her victory, new Democratic congresswoman Susie Lee on Nevada tells CBSN political reporter Caitlin Huey-Burns that she would not push for impeachment proceedings against President Trump if elected.

articles.author: Caroline Linton
articles.title: CNN's Jim Acosta denied entry to White House
articles.description: Acosta sparred with President Trump at a combative press conference earlier in the day
articles.content: The White House has suspended CNN reporter Jim Acosta's press pass Wednesday, hours after he sparred with President Trump at a press briefing. Acosta posted a video on Twitter showing him being denied entry. Earlier Wednesday, Acosta had questioned Mr. Trump … [+1326 chars]

articles.title: Voters turn out at the polls to "see more change"
articles.description: Voters across the country turned out in big numbers to cast their ballots and make their voices heard. "CBS Evening News" heard from some of the them about why they went to the polls.

articles.title: Democratic House majority brings a new reality to Washington
articles.description: After winning the majority in the House Tuesday night, Democrats will have the power to investigate the president or his cabinet members. They can also compel top officials to testify about controversial policies or foreign investments in Trump properties. CB…

articles.title: Health care a major factor for voters in Arizona Senate race
articles.description: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi said Wednesday that health care was on the ballot and "won." The issue was a major factor in the Nevada Senate race. CBS News correspondent Jamie Yuccas reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Florida AG Pam Bondi under consideration for attorney general
articles.description: Bondi has long been an ally of the president
articles.content: Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi is a possible contender to permanently replace Attorney General Jeff Sessions, sources familiar with the matter tell CBS News. President Trump forced Sessions out as the nation's chief law enforcement officer on Wednesday, o… [+1909 chars]

articles.title: Record turnout energized voters in the midterms
articles.description: In the leadup to the midterm elections, there's been a lot of talk about record turnout, and the impact it could have on each party. CBS News elections and surveys director Anthony Salvanto joins "CBS Evening News" with a look at the results.

articles.title: Jeff Sessions' resignation affect special counsel investigation
articles.description: Jeff Sessions is the first to leave the Trump administration after the midterm elections. His exit could have profound effects on special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation. CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe reports.

articles.title: Key races in Florida and Georgia still undecided day after midterms
articles.description: Several high-profile midterm races have not been decided yet. In the Georgia governor's race, Republican Brian Kemp has a narrow lead. In the Florida Senate race, Rick Scott is leading. CBS News national correspondent Manuel Bojorquez is following the latest.

articles.title: Suburban voters propel Democrats to victories in midterms
articles.description: Democrats flipped 29 House seats Tuesday night in districts from Oklahoma to Illinois. According to a CBS News exit poll, suburban women swung dramatically in this election, helping Democrats to victory. CBS News correspondent Omar Villafranca reports.

articles.title: Former female refugees make history with midterm victories
articles.description: The midterm elections marked a number of "firsts," including victories for two women who are former refugees. CBS News senior national correspondent Jim Axelrod reports.

articles.title: Trump celebrates midterm results despite House loss
articles.description: The day after the midterms, President Trump celebrated the election results, focusing on the seats Republicans gained in the Senate. He downplayed the Democratic takeover of the House, saying there's a good chance the parties can work together. CBS News natio…

articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Wednesday, November 7, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Jeff Glor.

articles.title: Can Trump work with a Democratic House?
articles.description: After Democrats took control of the House, President Trump talked about bipartisanship. But can that happen? Dan Senor, a former senior adviser to Paul Ryan and Mitt Romney in the 2012 presidential campaign, and CBS News' Nancy Cordes join "CBS Evening News" …
